questions.question_text:
In order to reduce product and project risk for a large, complex project, a business analyst is asked to help develop a change process that includes formal authorization and tracking throughout the life cycle of the project. The business analyst needs a capability that will help ensure that the product conforms to approved requirements, changes can be documented, and the status of each change can be reported.
What should the business analyst use?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Configuration management system
A configuration management system (CMS) is a set of processes, procedures, and tools that enable the business analyst to manage the project's configuration items throughout the project's lifecycle. Configuration management ensures that the project's products and artifacts are properly identified, controlled, and tracked, and that changes are managed through a formal process. The CMS also provides a way to report the status of each change and helps to ensure that the product conforms to approved requirements.

questions.question_text:
During validation of a project solution, the business analyst discovers that a requirement has been altered. Instead of placing the company logo in the upper-left corner of the window, it is displayed in the upper-right corner. When the business analyst asks the developer about the change, the developer says that one of the stakeholders asked directly for the change.
Which correct action should the business analyst take?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct action for the business analyst to take in this situation is to follow the change control process as defined in the business analysis plan.

When a change is made to a requirement during the validation phase of a project, it is important to follow a defined process for managing and approving such changes. The business analysis plan should outline the steps to be taken when a change is identified, including who should be notified and how the impact of the change should be assessed.

In this case, the business analyst should follow the change control process defined in the business analysis plan. This may involve seeking approval from the appropriate stakeholders, assessing the impact of the change on the project, and making any necessary updates to the project plan.

choices.A: Confront the stakeholder that requested the change.
choices.C: Discuss the change in the next stakeholder meeting.
choices.B: Follow the change control process as defined in the business analysis plan.
choices.D: Ask the developer to correct the logo as stated in the requirement.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Business case should be used to address the possible risks of having to cancel the product if the costs are exceeding the perceived benefits. The business case outlines the justification for the project, including the expected benefits, costs, and risks, and is used to evaluate whether the project is still viable as it progresses.

questions.question_text:
A few months into a project, the business analyst determines that the costs are exceeding the perceived benefits. The business analyst wants to address the possible risks of having to cancel the product.
Which of the following documents should be used?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Decision-making process in the business analysis plan

The business analyst should have defined the decision-making process in the business analysis plan. This includes outlining the steps for making decisions and resolving conflicts during requirements workshops. By having a well-defined decision-making process, the business analyst can help facilitate the group to reach an agreement by providing structure and guidance.

Selected Answer: A
PMI BA_Practitioners guide, section 3.4.12 - The decision-making process should be defined collaboratively with stakeholders inout. Once the team determines the decision process, it is documented within business analysis plan so the team has point of refernce when the work begins.

B. Clearly define the maximum acceptable error rate for the new system.
The best strategy to define the appropriate acceptance criteria for the new measurement system is to clearly define the maximum acceptable error rate for the new system. This will help ensure that the system meets the requirements of the operations manager, who is particularly concerned about accuracy due to the high cost of fixing measurement errors.

questions.question_text:
A business analyst is discussing the acceptance criteria for a new measurement system with the operations manager. The operations manager is particularly concerned about the accuracy of the new system because mistakes in data measurements could be extremely costly to fix.
Which of the following is the best strategy to define the appropriate acceptance criteria?

choices.C: Ask the operations manager to formally accept the requirements documents.
choices.B: Clearly define the maximum acceptable error rate for the new system.
choices.A: Quantify the risks associated with the measurement errors and update the risk register.
choices.D: Plan a training session for the new system before it is handed over to the operations manager.
